quantity.translation[0].definitions[0].d: an amount of something that can be counted or measured
quantity.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
He had consumed a large quantity of alcohol.
a large/small/vast etc quantity of something
Huge quantities of oil were spilling into the sea.
a large/small/vast etc quantity of something
Buy vegetables in small quantities, for your immediate use.
The police also found a quantity of ammunition in the flat.
Add 50 grams of butter, and the same quantity of sugar.
quantity.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The sheer quantity of text meant that people did not read the whole of their newspaper.
quantity.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: A large quantity of clothing was stolen from the shop.
The Romans imported a great quantity of sculpture from Greece.
Computers can handle vast quantities of data.
Dolphins need to eat considerable quantities of food.
How did they obtain sufficient quantities of food to survive?
Remove a small quantity of butter from the fridge.
This truly great wine is only made in tiny quantities.
The rock contains minute quantities of copper.
quantity.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an amount of something that can be counted or measured
quantity.translation[1].definitions[0].e: A small quantity of our oil is sold to France.
Stock managers have raised huge quantities of cash.
Citrus fruits are grown but not in commercial quantities (=amounts large enough to be sold).
quantity.translation[1].definitions[1].d: used to talk about how much of something there is
quantity.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The quantity and quality of personnel is inadequate.
quantity.translation[1].definitions[2].e: We offer special prices if you buy in quantity.
quantity.translation[1].definitions[3].d: someone or something that people know something about or know very little about
quantity.translation[1].definitions[3].e: The new director is a known quantity, having served as finance administrator to the company from 1986 to 90.
The administration of an annuity is an unknown quantity and the charge may rise from the current 1%.
